result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carrolee A. Moore

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:50 pm cases 22CF866, 22CM573 called and held via Zoom. Defendant Carrolee A. Moore appeared by video, in custody at Taycheedah.  Attorney William Lund Norine appeared by video for Carrolee A. Moore.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives their right to appear in person and Court accepts waiver. 
In felony file: Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas- Received by the Court. 
A status conference is scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 11:00 am (15 min, via Zoom).
Status conference on October 10, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

9:33 AM cases 22CF866, 22CM573 called.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Carrolee A. Moore in court, in custody.  Attorney William Lund Norine in court for Carrolee A. Moore. 

Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver in 22CF866.

Branch 2 for scheduling Arraignment.

Conditions:
No contact with K.M., P.M., or co-defendant R.P.
Communication through 3rd party for mom's medication needs.
Not to use/possess anyone else's personal identifying documents/information. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level. 
Not to act as fiduciary or Power of Attorney in any capacity of anyone else.
(Covers 22CM573, 22CF866)

11:19am Cases called: 22CM573 & 22CF866 Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Carrolee Moore appeared by video, in custody from the Eau Claire County Jail with Attorney Rachel Robole. Waives reading of the complaint. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. 

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 08/10/22 at 1:45pm
Hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
No contact with K.M., P.M., or co-defendant R.P.
Communication through 3rd party for mom's medication needs.
Not to use/possess anyone else's personal identifying documents/information.

Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level. 
Not to act as fiduciary or Power of Attorney in any capacity of anyone else.
